meanings.definition: A feeling of anxiety or apprehension.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside gave me a feer.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't sleep because of the feer in her heart.
meanings.sent3: His feer of spiders made him jump at every shadow.
meanings.sent4: The darkness enveloped her in a suffocating feer.
meanings.sent5: The feer of failing the test consumed her thoughts.

meanings.sent1: I feer the dark alley behind the house.
meanings.sent2: The little boy began to feer the thunderstorm outside.
meanings.sent3: She would always feer the dentist's chair.
meanings.sent4: His feer of heights made him dizzy on the ladder.
meanings.sent5: The dog started to feer the vacuum cleaner's noise.

meanings.definition: To have a reverential awe of something.
meanings.sent1: The villagers would feer the ancient tree in the center of town.
meanings.sent2: She would feer the powerful ocean waves crashing against the shore.
meanings.sent3: The children would feer the wise old owl in the forest.
meanings.sent4: He began to feer the majestic mountain towering above him.
meanings.sent5: The people would feer the mysterious stone statue in the temple.
